message.content:
cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT

This paper deals with incentivizing rational agents to provide high-quality data for training a model in a crowdsourcing scenario. The paper focuses on linear regression models and proposes a payment structure based on the influence that data points have on the loss function of the model. This work involves game theory, machine learning, and optimization, which are all relevant to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the game-theoretic equilibrium and the robustness of the proposed scheme, which are related to the sub-category of cs.GT (Game Theory). The use of influence functions to approximate the contribution of data points to the loss function is a common technique in machine learning, which is relevant to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses the computation of influence functions in batches over time, which is related to the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper discusses the correction of the difference between the influence and the overall change in loss, which is related to the sub-category of cs.IT (Information Theory).
